page.title: 17Leo's Hypermarket
page.content: Leo's is a good example of a hypermarket in our area.It was opened on July 12th 1983,following a national survey.It has a floor area of 33,000sq.ft.and parking space for 650 cars.It employs 115 staff.Most of the food sold in Leo's is imported.Two local wholesalers provide fresh fruit and vegetables, some of it grown locally.Leo's buy their bread and cakes from a local baker - Ferrari. Most people who shop at Leo's are female and they come from Portmead, Morriston,Sketty and other areas around Swansea.On average people spend around Â£20-Â£30 and go there twice a week.People buy all their groceries there,including fresh vegetables,meat and bread.Most people interviewed said that it was convenient and cheap and that there was more variety at Leo's.
